WorkItem.ClosedComment: Sounds like new Web Essentials build fixes this. Please reopen if that's not the case. Thanks!
WorkItem.Description: Dragging and dropping a .d.ts file into a .ts file from the solution explorer adds a reference in the form of /// reference path="ref1.d.ts" />. Spend hours of searching but couldn't find anything until I noticed that its missing the starting <. So it should be /// <reference path="ref1.d.ts" />. Can you reproduce this error?
WorkItem.Summary: Typescript visual studio plugin drag and drop reference error

Comments.Message: I have been able to reproduce.  Vote +1
The new 'Web Essentials 2012' extension of Mads Kristensen will also fix this problem.
You said Web Essentials 2012 will fix the problem but I have that and I still get the problem.

@RichardAlan - With the new Web Essentials 2012 extension I didn't meant the current 1.5.2 version. Mads fixed and sent me an updated intermediate version which isn't released yet. I attached that 'new' version as an attachment to this comment. So to be clear: this fix will be in the 1.5.3 or 1.6 version. But you can use the attached version in the meantime.
Is the specific to Web Essentials? When I drag and drop a .d.ts file, it simply produces the filename (without any /// or reference tag)

Web Essentials indeed adds the reference XML comments.
Like you noticed yourself, the plain TypeScript editor 'simply produces the filename (without any /// or reference tag)', which is not very handy.
